intro: Jasione montana f. hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy mountain everlasting, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is characterized by its compact, cushion-like growth habit and is native to the mountainous regions of Europe. The plant produces small, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its hirsute (hairy) foliage is a distinguishing feature, providing it with a unique texture. Jasione montana f. hirsuta is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
